column4: I am having trouble installing PDFMod (version 0.8.1) in Ubuntu 10.04 (64bit). I'm trying to do it via getdeb.net, but I am being told "Could not find package 'pdfmod'."
I am having trouble installing PDFMod (version 0.8.1) in Ubuntu 10.04 (64bit). I'm trying to do it via getdeb.net, but I am being told "Could not find package 'pdfmod'."
I am having trouble installing PDFMod (version 0.8.1) in Ubuntu 10.04 (64bit). I'm trying to do it via getdeb.net, but I am being told "Could not find package 'pdfmod'."
you can get pdfmod here: http://linux.softpedia.com/progDownload/PDF-Mod-Download-49673.html

- compiling that program is nearly impossible. Every time it tells me I am missing something I install it and then it has 900 other things it says I am missing. I've gotten to a point where I can't find what it wants me to have installed. Plus, why is getdeb doing this? I assumed the whole point of getdeb was to make installation easier, not to spit errors saying it doesn't have the file
I can't answer that, you could look at http://www.apt-get.org - search to see if the pdfmon package exists there.
searching getdeb.net for pdfmon, PDFmon returns nothing - probably why you can't get it there!
- http://www.getdeb.net/software/PDF%20Mod
- PDFMOD not 'pdfmon'
yikes, their own search fails! Why would you trust their packages!
ok - I take that back...
- i don't see it on that unofficial apt-get.org site
- any ideas? where can one get the deb file?
did you install their "getdeb" package?
- yes
- but i will do it again
- since i upgraded from 9.10 to 10.04..... who knows... all this stuff is so buggy anyways
yeah, I was able to retrieve/install the package...
pretty cool program, pdfmod that is...
- definitely... i think i got my situation figured out
what did you find?
- i had to add the new repository, reinstall the installation deb from the getdeb website and then it worked...
nice, glad to see you sorted it out :)
- definitely... thanks for the guidance!
